intro: Schrankia brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited schrankia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, rounded fruits that are typically less than 1 centimeter in diameter. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Schrankia brachycarpa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
